title: Kedia Daily Bullion Update As On 16072019
text:
Gold prices slipped as key China data assuaged concerns about the global economic slowdown and boosted appetite for riskier assets. Denting the bullion's appeal, encouraging Chinese data suggested the world's second-biggest economy may be starting to stabilize due to ramped-up stimulus from Beijing. China's June industrial output climbed 6.3% from a year earlier, beating a 5.2% forecast, while January-June fixed-asset investment rose 5.8% from the same period last year, surpassing a 5.5% increase forecasted. Meanwhile, China's economic growth slowed to 6.2% in the second quarter from a year earlier, the weakest pace in at least 27 years.



Meanwhile, hedge funds and money managers cut their bullish stance in COMEX in the week ended July 9, the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) said in a report. Physical gold buying stalled in top Asian hubs as consumers sold back bullion to cash in on a steep price rally, while a recent import duty hike further dented waning interest in an Indian market hit by a surge in local rates. Dealers were offering a discount of up to $20 an ounce over official domestic prices, down from $30 last week, the highest since August 2016. The domestic price includes the 12.5% import tax and a 3% sales duty. The activity was lackluster in Hong Kong as well, where gold was sold at anywhere from a discount of 30 cents to a $1.20 premium, compared with premiums of $0.50-$1.20 last week.



Technically market is under long liquidation as the market has witnessed a drop in open interest by -1.53% to settled at 16702 while prices down -23 rupees, now Gold is getting support at 34777 and below same could see a test of 34672 levels, and resistance is now likely to be seen at 34978, a move above could see prices testing 35074.



Trading Ideas:

# Gold trading range for the day is 34672-35074.

# Gold prices slipped as key China data assuaged concerns about the global economic slowdown and boosted appetite for riskier assets.

# Denting the bullion's appeal, encouraging Chinese data suggested the economy may be starting to stabilize due to ramped-up stimulus from Beijing.

# Hedge funds and money managers cut their bullish stance in COMEX gold in the week ended July 9, the U.S. CFTC said in a report.



Silver on MCX settled up 0.61% at 38625 as a boost in risk appetite from generally positive economic data was insufficient to derail demand in an environment marked by decreasing yields. Prices jumped in recent sessions amid expectations of an interest rate cut that will likely weaken the dollar and boost the metal. The US dollar fell pressured by expectations that the Federal Reserve will start cutting interest rates at a monetary policy meeting later this month.



Chicago Fed President Charles Evans said the US economy still has "very solid fundamentals" with a vibrant labor market. He said he viewed the Fed's monetary policy as neutral, but it could be more accommodative if the goal is to lift inflation The China’s GDP growth slowed to 6.2% year-on-year in the April-June period, data from the statistics bureau showed. The figure was in line with expectations but lower than first quarter’s 6.4% year-on-year growth.



Meanwhile, the country’s industrial manufacturing, retail sales, and fixed-asset investment figure all beat forecasts. On the data front, headline inflation at factory gates rose 1.7% from a year earlier in June, topping expectations for a larger drop to 1.6%, reports on Friday showed. In other news, tensions between China and the U.S. seemingly eased somewhat as Reuters reported that the U.S. may grant licenses for companies to restart sales to Chinese telecommunication equipment maker Huawei in as little as two weeks.



Technically the market is under fresh buying as market has witnessed gain in open interest by 2.6% to settled at 18055 while prices up 235 rupees, now Silver is getting support at 38370 and below same could see a test of 38114 levels, and resistance is now likely to be seen at 38770, a move above could see prices testing 38914.



Trading Ideas:

# Silver trading range for the day is 38114-38914.

# Silver prices steadied as a boost in risk appetite from generally positive economic data was insufficient to derail demand in an environment marked by decreasing yields.

# Prices jumped in recent sessions amid expectations of an interest rate cut that will likely weaken the dollar and boost the metal.

# The US dollar fell pressured by expectations that the Federal Reserve will start cutting interest rates at a monetary policy meeting later this month.
